intro: [WRONG START] Walenia jacquinioides subsp. jacquinioides, commonly known as the yellow billygoat weed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, often in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. The plant has alternate, narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. It is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in saline environments. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific floral morphology and geographic distribution.
